No Matter What You Do, You Cannot Lose The Game!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance Archive (GameBoy Advance): Ranching Tips: No Matter What You Do, You Cannot Lose The Game!
By Lisa Shock on Sunday, December 9, 2001 - 09:50 pm:

Ok, I will admit it. I lost at MR2. Sueki Suezo was my first monster, and after a few errantries, I ran out of money and could not feed my next monster one month right afterwards. Colt got sad and wished me luck, and the game re-started.

So, I was curious to see what happens in MRA if you lose. I used all my items, spent my money on more, which I used and finally got to 0G. Well, now there's the option to feed nothing. So the game just goes on. And, after 2 months of feeding nothing, my monster gave me some TapaurinN she found, worth 4,000G. So, unlike MR1 or MR2, you cannot really fail at this game.

By mepersoner on Sunday, December 9, 2001 - 10:53 pm:

Awwww... that sucks I enjoyed seeing the game over sign...

By Trickster on Monday, December 10, 2001 - 12:28 am:

*giggle* Personally, I just wish we could "hear" what your monster was saying.

"Oh great. So she's fiddled around, squandered all her cash. And here I am. Poor me, her faithful, loyal, all-important monster... not even getting fed. Guess it's up to ME to do something about it, again, since she doesn't seem to wanna get off her butt for some reason and enter me in a tournament... You'd think that she WANTED to not have any money or anything. Not that that Aroma's much better, primping for that Bolzoi guy. As if he's not too old for her. Yeesh. Well, I found this out in the garden, it looks old and raggedy which means it should be a 'collectable' for someone... Here, you. Yes, you. Here. No, really. Take it. Sell it. I mean it. Because I WANT FOOD!"
